website_summaries.verdict: A fairly inexpensive, durable, and powerful monocular lens that takes crisp and detail-packed shots from long distances, making it perfect for sporting events, concerts, and observing wildlife.
pros: Monocular lens magnifies up to 12 times what you could normally capture
cons: You may need to adjust and experiment with this lens to find the perfect setting for your iPhone

website_summaries.verdict: An outstanding monocular in a very competitive marketplace. We doubt you would be disappointed.
pros: Rugged exterior is waterproof, dustproof, fogproof, and shockproof
Owners give the company's customer service top marks
cons: Some users feel it's a bit bulky
Smartphone camera mount is of poor quality

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer services.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this product . I had a problem with the adapter included with monocular. I emailed to customer services and they responded very quickly . With a great solution. Alan help me to give a great solution. He replaced it and also send me the universal adapter for free of charge . Now I got it and I took beautiful pictures. This product is amaizing . I recommended it 100%
customer_reviews.author: Fermin

customer_reviews.title: I will be in the total solar eclipse and don't want to pay for a crazy good camera (my s8 is a great shot)
customer_reviews.text: Stunning! This arrived today and I have had a blast figuring it out! I will be in the total solar eclipse and don't want to pay for a crazy good camera (my s8 is a great shot). Unfortunately, it weakens with distance. Not so with this monocular! It took just a minute of tweaking the automatic focus on my phone, and adjusting the clarity on my monocular... Let me just say, this is awesome! The attached pics show a flower 3 houses down (probably 80 yards) with and without the monocular. I look forward to using this hunting as well!
customer_reviews.author: sterken

customer_reviews.title: I recieved the monocular today but it did NOT come ...
customer_reviews.text: I recieved the monocular today but it did NOT come with the cell phone holder. It feels high quality but since it did not come with the cell phone holder I cannot use it. The point of this product is to be able to use it with your cell phone right? There is also no email or phone number for me to contact them in regards to this matter either. Update: my review was hidden from the public. Just an FYI for everybody
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe the pictures
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for a family vacation and it did not disappoint. I didn't want to spend lots of money for a new camera that I would not know how to use. Once I realized that I could leave the bracket to attach the lens on my phone and still take regular pictures and answer my phone, it made switching between the lens and my phone so much easier. My only minor complaint is that when I zoomed in, sometimes the color was less vibrant. (Could have been user error). Great price for great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on the I phone 7 plus or I’m just dumb
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be great for taking pictures is my grandsons at swim meets and soccer matches. I spent more than 5 hours trying to line it up. Without the scope I had a picture but once I put the scope on no matter what I did I could not get it to focus to even attempt a picture. I ultimately got frustrated and just sent it back. I would not recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Dru E Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Birdwatching-
customer_reviews.text: love the lens -comparable to a much more expensive monocular lens that I have. The attachment to the iPhone 6 works great . Here is my first picture taken through a window // I am looking forward to heading outside ..a tripod would be a help I think... the part that attaches to the iPhone also works with another lens I have -which is great. I am not trying to take perfect pictures but want to catch pics of birds to identify. There was a part that wasn't working on the iPhone attacher..but I contacted the SELLER and he got me a perfect part immediately-it was GREAT SERVICE!!
customer_reviews.author: R. R. McDonnell

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the best customer service I have ever experienced through an online purchase. The monocular works just fine. It has an adjustable focal length, so you can focus on both near and far objects. It's very compact and convenient to take with you, and the case has a loop to place on your belt. The mount that came with the monocular to attach a phone was not quite what I was expecting. It did not consistently hold my phone in place. So I contacted the company, and promptly they replied and sent me an upgraded replacement which sells on Amazon for about $18. This was sent at no cost. A very quality product with a very responsive seller.
customer_reviews.author: Rexman

customer_reviews.title: Be sure you have a listed phone!
customer_reviews.text: This item worked as expected when I had an iPhone 6, but can't be made to work with an iPhone 11--which to be fair is not listed as being supported. An inquiry to the manufacturer about what to do wasn't answered. On the 6 it produced a reasonable telephoto image, but in round format--it would have to be cropped or edited if you want anything else. Truth to tell it was beyond my skill set to reformat the image, and I didn't use it much before getting a new phone. Don't expect this item to produce high quality images.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Olsen

customer_reviews.title: It quickly broke and promises to replace it didn't take place
customer_reviews.text: I was attracted by the extremely reasonable price (too reasonable!) and reports of how one could attach an iPhone and take pictures through it. Another lesson in how you get what you pay for, also how it pays to buy recognized brands. Researching the manufacturer it looked like this was a product that Amazon commissioned.
customer_reviews.author: Rob  Dreyfus

customer_reviews.title: Light and Packable
customer_reviews.text: Have wanted a telescope for eons but tight city living spaces and obscured viewing by other buildings made it impractical or taking it outside. Finally we had clear night skies and am pleased with this great alternative. It's lightweight to carry, pretty well made, nice size and easy to focus one-handed for moongazing (cannot comment on accessory for iPod type phone video recording - I don't have). The lens view was crispy clear and sale price perfect for my pocket. Binoculars have been troublesome in the past for me and really found this so much easier to focus. I could see the shaded craters on the moon and so it is quite sufficient for my stargazing.
customer_reviews.author: YAC

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t impressed with the optics (brightness, clarity, detail). Compared to a 10x monocular (over 3x the cost), it doesn’t appear to me that this is 12 power. I’m guessing 9 - 11. I don’t think it’s bad for the price. It also turns out that monocular are not for me, I would prefer a compact binocular. I’m up in age with small pupil size and not so steady hands.
customer_reviews.author: PWDerry

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you plan to use phone adaptor for your iPhone 7+
customer_reviews.text: Phone adaptor will not stay on. Try to tighten and it slips off. Your very expensive phone could crash and break for trying to use this $60 monocular. Tried 6 times. If vendor can fix I will revise rating. Otherwise, I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: I have been using it for Bird watching and am very happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: You can beat this for the money. Please be realistic you will not be taking pictures you can send to National Geographic but for the investment is very much worth it. I have been using it for Bird watching and am very happy with the results. I recommend you set up the phone first make sure the hole is well lines up and then add it to the scope. Easy to connect but not seamless so I tend to set it up and leave it connected during my walk or trip.
customer_reviews.author: ebatiz

customer_reviews.title: Nice for getting closer looking pictures
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a couple times now & it seems to work good for getting closer (zoomed in) pictures of wildlife. If you have a thick protective case on your phone, it does not work as well, as a friend tried it. Even my thin Lifeproof case does not allow the phone to fit flush, but I have been able to get some good pictures. Be sure to turn the flash off though. Fit the adapter to the phone first. Adapter can be a little awkward putting onto the monocular the first time or two. I carry them in my Harley tour pack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Binocular part is OK. The photolens part is not the best option.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a handy binoculars, which is easy to carry and can be put in a pocket, this is a good option. But the smart phone attachment is a poor alternative to the telephoto lenses that are now available for all major mobile phones at very reasonable prices. The lens does not give you full screen image when attached to a phone. You get a cropped circle, which you may have to Photoshop to have a full frame image. The image clarity is also average.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The version I bought is the12X50 monocular and it is great. I compared it to my older 7X50 binoculars (Focal brand from the 70's) and it performs better in low light and increases the magnification. I was considering buying the 12X55, newer, version of this but decided to go for the older version with the lower price. The phone attachment for taking pictures is the newer one and feels very solid. I'm not sure what the difference is between monoculars that cost $200 or more and this one but I think I got my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs4Pals

customer_reviews.title: Clunky
customer_reviews.text: I’m embarrassed I bought this. Stupid. Cannot easily clip on/off phone- clunky. The case provided won’t hold both pieces. Does magnify but not enough to justify the weight and clunkiness. Photo image is a 2” x 2” circle.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Great Monocular but Needs Improvement for Attachments
customer_reviews.text: Compact, convenient, easy to use and works well with our Galaxy phones, iPhones and all by itself. Only a couple of things stop me from giving it a five. The phone adapter doesn't fit in the carrying case, and the eyepiece cover isn't attached to anything - making both easy to lose or misplace. Adding a small strap for the cover and a pocket on the case for the adapter would have been ideal. Also, I should have realized I would need a tripod. Zooming far away makes getting a steady picture nearly impossible by hand.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: A cool little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thing. Very cool. It works well for spotting wildlife and I have been able to take some pretty cool photos as well. I would definitely recommend it. This red tailed hawk was captured from about 70 yards away. :)
customer_reviews.author: TraciB

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use, slow to install or remove.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to put on camera, took on safari to Tanzania and found it to be totally useless, no one in family found it to be of any value.
customer_reviews.author: Roger O. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Item is great quality and does what it says perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband. It has incredible visibility and brings things up close easily. We watch the wildlife on our ranch and photograph them with our iphone with the included iphone attachment. We "shoot" with the camera and monocular not with a gun. It does exactly as we hoped and are so pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a binocular for our short trips, but after several reviews I decided to go for a monocular instead. There were a bunch of monocular options at Amazon, but after careful product reviews (Amazon+Google+Youtube), I felt that Gosky is a better product. I went with 12x power, since that would give me some decent images of the moon as well. So far I am really happy with my purchase. The included phone adaptor works well but you may have to spend some time setting it up. Viewing experience is better thru a phone once you have setup your adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: Binish

customer_reviews.title: You will never,
customer_reviews.text: You will never, ever line up your phone to the little holder to get a photo to work unless you are working with something as small as an iPhone 5
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Great service
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed my Gosky Titan monocular since I bought it slightly over two years ago. It is light weight and can easily fit into my pocket when I take a walk. I find it most valuable on the golf course to get a quick look at a bird that flies into view without annoying the other golfers.. The service provided by Alan after I recently accidentally dropped it was exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Nice monocular worth looking at
customer_reviews.text: Received today, after having to return another monocular that was defective, and at a lower price. The defect on the other monocular was a PLASTIC 1/4 20 tripod mount... Buyer-be-wear! This 12X50 monocular is comparable to others listed here, but I can assure you that the tripod mount socket is 1/4 20 BRASS! As it should be. Attached a picture taken with the monocular and my iPhone 7.
customer_reviews.author: Jay F.

customer_reviews.title: In 2017, Chinese glass can be very good.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for the monocular: it is almost sharp as my German binos costing almost 10 times more. 1 star for the phone adapter: simply slips off the phone the moment one holds it to take the photo. Review update: I compared it to the Bushnell 10X42mm M-Series binoculars and was shocked to see that this monocular yields an smaller image. My estimate is that its magnification is about 9X at most, not 12X. I am taking off 2 Stars for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for rhe price
customer_reviews.text: My son was fascinated with pirates and military stuff, he has been using my old scope from the BB gun to play out his fantasy. Decided to get this to surprise him, and I can't tell you how happy he was. He was amazed to find that he can see the craters on the moon. Tried mounting it on the tripod with the cellphone attachment, it took some time to set it up, but it did work for bird watching and pictures as advertised. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie Chan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!! You will love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: An iPhone 7 and this Gosky Titan 12X50 High Power Prism Monocular and Quick Smartphone Holder was used to take these pictures. The installation is not an easy task because instructions were not included but it is self explanatory. With a little patience you will be satisfied. The videos are as good as the pictures, however I would recommend using a tripod for the videos to stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: LISA G

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Great Company Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this unit for multiple years now and have many other hunting buddies that have it as well. This is a great product that is easy to use and has always worked well for intended use. I purchased one for my father in 2017 for Fathers Day and the plastic piece that tightens onto monocular broke. He told me about it, I emailed Gosky through amazon and they replied within 2 hours offering to replace the part, including an additional piece for back up, and a new tripod. My dad was happy to hear. Stuff like this will keep me using them down the road. Thanks Alan with Gosky!
customer_reviews.author: Chase G.

customer_reviews.title: Monocular good. Case and covers poor
customer_reviews.text: The carrying case is a little flimsy. The belt loop broke pretty quickly, Therr is a loop on the eye cover which would lead me to think that they could have put a string on it but they didn't and it seems easy to lose The overall size and performance is pretty good and I have no complaints
customer_reviews.author: D. Gross

customer_reviews.title: great idea but....
customer_reviews.text: The scope itself is very good quality but it is pretty bulky when attached to my iphone. My hope was to shoot pics of birds at distance. I cannot find a way to stabilize it and find it cumbersome to carry with scope in place. if you have voice control on your shoot mode of your phone it might be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: At this price it is much nicer than I expected. Feels like a quality device. Decent weight, good rubberize exterior with good grip, with tripod mount. Eyepiece adjustment for eyeglass wearers. Phone adapter works well and is easy and quick to setup. Works well with my Moto G Power.
customer_reviews.author: Ryley Isetter

customer_reviews.title: PHONE MOUNT USELESS
customer_reviews.text: 1. POOR PHONE CAMERA ATTACHMENT...takes LONGER THAN I EXPECTED TO GET IT LINED UP WITH CAMERA ON PHONE. 2. Once it’s lined up, it does bring target object in close, however you better have supernatural steady hands or have it on a tripod, or pic will be blurry. 3. When used as monocular, it’s a 5 STAR INSTRUMENT.
customer_reviews.author: cdk

customer_reviews.title: Skip this if your thinking you use with your phone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for whale watching and wow, what a train wreck. Its awkward to hold as designed with the phone. Don't trust it so we dumped the cheap cell phone clamp that was poorly designed and just used the optics as a monocular.
customer_reviews.author: K. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well with dual lens phones
customer_reviews.text: I have an iPhone 8+ and this does not work well with my phone. If it’s not exactly right it gets caught between the 2 lenses and gives you only black. Works fine with older, single lens phones. Bummed that it wasn’t worth using. I took it to alaska and ended up just packing it away after day 1
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Rather bulky
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to carry around on my hikes in nature. I’m sure the magnification is as specified, which is adequate, but it’s just so large. I have a tendency not to use it because it is too bulky.
customer_reviews.author: topamp

customer_reviews.title: Bird Watching Just Got Better
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monocular for it's strength and have been having a blast with the camera attachment feature. It produces beautiful pics and it's easy to use (smaller phones work better than an iphone 8+). Easier to carry because it takes less space and is lighter than a traditional pair of binocs, this is a well-made product that delivers well!
customer_reviews.author: L. Beggins

customer_reviews.title: Poor image quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This scope is functional, but given the low quality image it is hardly worth the price (I paid about $60 for it). Its plusses are that it is small, light, and sturdy. The minus is image quality, which does not come through as crisp or clear as one would expect at this price range. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: beau_type

customer_reviews.title: A surprisingly good gift
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift to my dad. He is into photographing now, and sometimes complain that his equipment is so heavy. I bought this little one for him, thinking that it will be a little toy. Surprisingly, he seems to have a lot of fun with it. He already took a bunch of good pictures of the backyard animals (birds, ducks, squirrels etc.) with his iPhone. The monocular is made with good quality, and very stable with the phone, and the picture is quite clear. And he even started teaching my 7-year-old son how to use it, and they both are enjoying it quite much. Will definitely put it into more use, like traveling, camping, going to concert etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jemimakids

customer_reviews.title: Received by mistake, but I tried it anyway.
customer_reviews.text: Received this by mistake, but didn’t realize until I took it out of the box. Maybe it was just me, but I had trouble getting focused on anything about 100-200’ away. If I look for a replacement, I’ll get an image stabilized unit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity very clear.
customer_reviews.text: Great monocular.. very clear- optics are fantastic.. I take it whenever I go out, to the beach or a trail anywhere where there is wildlife especially birds..
customer_reviews.author: Pony trekker

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Didn't receive all components of the order. Missing smart phone adapter and because of time restraints I am keeping and ordering a stand alone adapter of my own, costing me 23.00 extra. I'm sure it's a great product reading all the reviews but you got one fundament thing wrong.... the product received is incomplete. Super disappointed and feeling over the barrel on this one.
customer_reviews.author: M Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Phone adapter won’t stay on monocular.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this in the box and finally opened for a planned trip. The phone adapter sure won’t stay on the monocular. Trying to tighten it only makes it slip off. I would need 3 hands to get a marginally ok picture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: monocular is great. good quality but the holder for your phone ...
customer_reviews.text: monocular is great. good quality but the holder for your phone (to use as camera) will not stay on monocular. The way the monocular end is made, it will fit on, but will not stay....slips right off, which makes it completely useless. Again the monocular is great but wanted to use it w I Phone and tho I can fit my IPhone on it, it will not stay to even take a picture. A waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a stable platform
customer_reviews.text: This works awesome as described but you will need a tripod. The picture is so zoomed in slight movement is hard to focus. I got great shots of the super moon on my Google Pixel 3 with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Optics
customer_reviews.text: One hand focusing. Good heft feels well made. Great optics. Only downside is that the eyepiece cover is not secured to the unit. Have to use string to tie it to monocular.
customer_reviews.author: D Mart

customer_reviews.title: Well built Monocular, it does the job
customer_reviews.text: The monocular arrives fast, and it is very well built. It came with a piece of lens cloth, monocular case, and an accessory that can help to fix the monocular on your phone, very good design. The monocular body is not metallic but soft touch plastic, and it also has two caps to protect the lens. I will definitely bring this monocular in my next vacation to watch wildlife.
customer_reviews.author: James L

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE This
customer_reviews.text: I have tested out: 1) This Gosky 12X50 monocular - which I love for its wonderful performance. And I have also tested out: 2) the Roxant 6X30 monocular - which I ALSO love for its performance. But I have also tested out: 3) The Roxant 7X18 monocular - which is absolute JUNK grossly lacking in clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Godspeed

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Outdoorsman
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend and he loves it! As an avid hunter, he stated its perfect for spotting. Picture quality will drpend on the phone beong used, should you want pics at all.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Don't like product
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase this again. I bought for a cruise and I regret buying it. Hard to hook up and take photos with any movement.
customer_reviews.author: Keri L.

customer_reviews.title: This is a higher quality monulocuar
customer_reviews.text: Used this to potograph birds and other wildlife in Costa Rico - the pictures came out great there is some hassel getting it set up and since I didn't carry a tripod it's a bit difficult to stabilize the shot but can be done-- super clear photos on my Google pixel
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Baller

customer_reviews.title: Good for looking, not the greatest photography
customer_reviews.text: The picture was not real clear But I think it is the camera I am using on my phone It did bring things in a long ways. It attached nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The monocular works great! It is heavy and covered in rubber, easy to hold, won't slip off your hand easily, and feels so solid it can probably survive a 5 foot drop. The digiscoping adapter is well made. It can hold the phone and monocular tightly. I just wish the carrying case it came with could hold both the monocular and adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Nabor

customer_reviews.title: Great for viewing birds or rocket launch!
customer_reviews.text: We got this to take with us on a recent trip, and this is much superior to binoculars! It's easy to focus, even while wearing glasses, fits in a jacket pocket, and a great aid to identifying birds or watching a rocket launch (we did both).
customer_reviews.author: Z. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Not what u think
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as one would think. Bought for an xmas gift. Severely disappointed. Do not recomend this product
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: As stated
customer_reviews.text: Son liked it. Attached to phone easily, and provided clear closeups. Unfortunately, the entire thing does not fit into carrying case. All parts are needed to attach to phone, so be prepared to carry separately or buy a different case.
customer_reviews.author: jbyars

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it was to use. But zooming out left me concerned as it didn’t actually zoom out. And the magnification was somewhat underwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Heath

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monocular
customer_reviews.text: Hoping to get it connected to my phone and get some real closeups of squirrels and birds. THank you Gosky. Danny
customer_reviews.author: Danny Doege

customer_reviews.title: correct adapter helps monocular work well with iphone
customer_reviews.text: The monocular works great, unfortunately it will not stay in the adapter. It is difficult to hold both pieces together, as the adapter fits well on the iPhone 6. While tightening the adapter to the monocular, the monocular slides right out. i sent in above review, and got an immediate reply. I received a replacement adapter, and it works well. it easily adjusts, and will help taking pictures at a distance with my iPhone. thank you for quick fix to the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: From all the hype in the description I thought these would have been better. Image did not seem all that sharp to me. I think spending a little more will get a much better monocular.
customer_reviews.author: TX

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Not quite the quality I was expecting in terms of zoomability?) is that a word?). Otherwise just as advertised. Good value to the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: 100% happy customer great quality
customer_reviews.text: This things worth every penny it's freaking awesome!!! For someone who never tried monoculars it's great to use for beautiful scenery. Phone holder holds it for mostly any phone. Comes with a great cleaning cloth its so cool. Yall will understand what im saying if you get 1
customer_reviews.author: jmh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Took a nice photo of a bald eagle about 100 yds. away from a pontoon boat that was rocking up and down in the water
customer_reviews.author: Savvy1777

customer_reviews.title: God product, decent price
customer_reviews.text: Good power, decent field of vision. Remember the greater the magnification, the more vulnerable to wobble. After reading of the difficulties folks were having with the cell phone camera on just aboit every monocular out there, I didn't even try it out; but I would imagine you'd need a tripod
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lens are impossible to keep still...
customer_reviews.text: This optical is lame! It is virtually impossible to get a stable image!....while looking through the optical you can actually see everything jumping to your heart beat.......total waste......
customer_reviews.author: andre alph

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the hardware itself is amazing for the price and the quality of the visual ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product! The quality of the hardware itself is amazing for the price and the quality of the visual you get with this monocular is flawless. The customer service was also excellent (thanks Alan) in order to resolve a minor issue with the initial order.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality item. I bought it before I realized that my wife bought me one. I like it so much that I decided to keep both. Great clarity and quality built. It would be a great deal even it it cost a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moog

customer_reviews.title: Super fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: This feels heavy enough to seem like it should be more expensive but is very reasonably priced. It has a great crisp clear view through it. I ordered it on Friday morning and had it by 9 am the next morning. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amylj1971

customer_reviews.title: This monocular is very useful to look faraway
customer_reviews.text: This monocular is very useful to look faraway. My kids love it very much and use it to watch the airplane and the seagulls flying through the sky. How great is that it can be connect to the phone and take clear pictures through the monocular. The weight is light and the design is great. It is a wonderful gift for anyone who uses cell phone. The shipping is fast and the price is reasonable. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Klzg

customer_reviews.title: Missing Cellphone holder
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough as a monocular. The zoom seems a little light, but what do I know. More importantly, half the reason I bought this one was for the cell holder, and mine did not come with it. So, just, buyer beware. If that's a selling point for you, you may not get it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaeon

customer_reviews.title: Too cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Takes forever to set up to the point you have to have it attached all the time. You can't just pick it up and whip it together and by then the pic is gone. Would return but I used it so no go. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not reccomended
customer_reviews.text: Might work ok if you don't have a case on your phone. When tighten securely on phone with case it crimps the screen and navigation functions do not work.
customer_reviews.author: SamIAm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for nature viewing!
customer_reviews.text: I've got my cell phone hooked up to this and can't wait to take some amazing shots out west!
customer_reviews.author: Joolz

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to take pictures of the moon. You definitely need a tripod and bluetooth camera button. Also, zoom in on the phone to get rid of the circle pictures. Pictures are from 2 different days.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Not a good scope
customer_reviews.text: I got closer views with my camera lens and binoculars. Not a good scope.
customer_reviews.author: NAM

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: It took a little bit to get it to work but that was expected
customer_reviews.author: Stacey M Toepfert

customer_reviews.title: Clear images and helpful monocular
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monocular for my daught. She really loves it, the view is very clear. She used it for watching birds and squirrels on the tree. For me, I really like the smartphone adapter very much. It is convenient for me to mount my phone on this monocular, and the images are very clear. Attached is the photo took by my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Jia Wang

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get......great buy.
customer_reviews.text: This product is as described and is very good quality. The attachment for the I Phone usage is easy to install. It's use is determined by the purchaser's ability to hold steady. Easy magnification system.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E. Billeb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: At first I had my doubts about buying this scope because I had previously bought one that was worthless and ended up returning it. But this one works well, I am using it mainly for photographing birds on my deck. I have an iPhone 6s and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Alexis

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent item and we have used it several times when ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent item and we have used it several times when we go to the theater. The only reason I gave it 4 vs 5 stars is that it is somewhat difficult to get it to work as a telephoto lens for the iPhone. It is doable just not easy.
customer_reviews.author: Don W. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and I absolutely love it. I should get a stand to put it on because if you have shaky hands like I do it makes it hard to take good pictures. The item itself is great and I took some beautiful pictures of the birds on my feeders. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Maybe user error, I’m keeping it and determined to make it easy to use. It’s hard to get the camera aligned
customer_reviews.author: LT in SA

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful addition to my home for bird watching, but I especially liked it on my vacation in the mountains!!! Great price and good quality! I don't love the wrist band; had a fee issues with that, but would still recommend this monocular to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: JKK

customer_reviews.title: This product have best view in outdoor adventures
customer_reviews.text: This product have best view in outdoor adventures. Absolutely you can carry it instead of the heavy zoom lens. The image is very clear and easy to adjust. Every one can become a professional photographer from an amateur.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Some decent shots
customer_reviews.text: Got this for some night shots of the moon. Pretty good but not easy to focus. Had fun with it though.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dearborn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and comfortable to hold. Picture quality great, but not perfect. I use this when I go to the theatre and it's great!
customer_reviews.author: solacelee

customer_reviews.title: great closeups
customer_reviews.text: Got this to watch our blue birds, it works great. From the door to the birdhouse is over 100 feet. It takes great a picture (if I focus correctly). I should have brought the stand, it's a bit heavy to hold and focus at same time.
customer_reviews.author: Retired RVer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: No need to bring my DSLR camera anymore on vacation, this does it all!!!
customer_reviews.author: Noel P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely enjoy it. Only thing I would do if you use the phone piece is get the tripod for the monocular to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: TonkaTruck87

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Phone attachment broke immediately - never really worked. Spotting scope however does work and I still occasionally use it apart from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: I lost both caps almost immediately and turns out you ...
customer_reviews.text: I lost both caps almost immediately and turns out you _have_ to use a tripod to make any sort of non-blurry picture on phone.
customer_reviews.author: Valentin Konovalov

customer_reviews.title: Phone attachment is a joke. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The monocular itself is nice, but the attachment for your phone is a joke. I bought it for the sole purpose of using it with my phone. Needless to say, I was very disappointed. If they improved the design of the holder, this would be a much better product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent images for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Clear images, easy to use, very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: W Mulder

customer_reviews.title: The clarity is good. The mounting system is a little but difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone mount and the optic are well worth the price. The clarity is good. The mounting system is a little but difficult to use at first but once you figure out how it is supposed to work, its managable.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I like traveling and hunting
customer_reviews.text: I like traveling and hunting.This is an awesome little monocular.I take it with me almost everywhere . It is great and works perfectly. Clear and easy operation.
customer_reviews.author: Therese L

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Yep. That's the thing I bought for gift. Hope it works
customer_reviews.author: SHANNON A SHARP

customer_reviews.title: Gonna Explore Nature
customer_reviews.text: I experimented with this at home. I bought it for a trip out west and for local bird watching. Seems to do the job. It fits well onto my iPhone 6, even in phone case. The optics are clear, without distortion
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to attach. Not for spontaneous pics
customer_reviews.text: Not good for quick access to capture nature or action shots from far away. By the time you go get it, remove your phone case (because attaching it while the case is on is a bitch and ruins the effect), attach it and focus...the moment is gone. It's not something you would carry around with you either. Now if you have it attached, focused and ready you will get some beautiful photos.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Forgeron

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my teen and he loves using it when he camps.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again...after looking around again of course. Nothing about this sticks out to me any more than any of the others in its price range
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

product_meta.title: Gosky Titan 12X50 High Power Prism Monocular and Quick Smartphone Holder - Waterproof Fog- Proof Shockproof Scope -BAK4 Prism FMC for Bird Watching Hunting Camping Travelling Wildlife Secenery
feature_bullets: 12X50 High Power Magnification Monocular Telescope- Have the best view in your outdoor adventures. To see 12X closer with a clear and bright image with the generous, light-gathering 50mm objective wide lens. Perfect for Hiking,Hunting,Climbing,Birdwatching, Ball games,Watching Wildlife and Scenery.

Comes with a Gosky 2020 newest quick alignment smartphone adapter mount. Compatible with phone Xs, X, Xr, 8plus, 8,7plus, 7,6, 6s, 6plus, 5, 5s, 4s,SE, Samsung GALAXY S10, S9, S8, S6, S6, S5, S10 Edge, Note, LG, HTV, Sony, and almost all other smartphones on the market.

Large BAK-4 Prism inside and Fully Multi-coated(FMC) Lens Coating - Strengthen the key function of a monocular, guarantee superior light transmission and brightness, make your view brighter, clearer and delivers crisp images.

Solid Framework and shock-absorbing Rubber Armor with Stripes -Its tight fitting protection makes it usable to withstand the toughest weather conditions. And The rubber armor with stripes makes it comfortable for use and keeps it from slipping out from your hand.
Waterproof, Dust-proof, and Shockproof Design: Nitrogen-filled waterproof and O-ring sealed optics prevent moisture, dust and debris and ensures the living waterproof function.
